prompt: Please explain to me how gravity works - as if I am a 5 year old.
orig_response: Gravity is like a big hug from the Earth. You know how when you give your favorite teddy bear a big hug, you want to keep it close to you? The Earth is like a big teddy bear, and it wants to keep everything close to it too. That's why things don't float off into space when you drop them. The Earth's hug pulls everything towards it, so your toys, your ball, and even you stay on the ground. It's like the Earth is saying, "I love you, stay close to me!" And that's why we don't float away when we're standing on the ground.
response: Gravity is **lik**e a big hug from the Earth. **You know how **when you give your favorite teddy bear a big hug, you want to keep it close to you? The Earth is like a big teddy bear**, and i**t wants to keep everything close to it** too**. **That'**s why things don't float off into space when you drop them. **The Earth's hu**g pulls everything towards it**, so your toys, your ball, and even **you stay on the ground. **It's like **the Earth is saying****, "I love you, stay close to me**!**" **And that's why **we don't float away when we're standing on the ground.

revised_fact_jsonified_all.revised_unit: Gravity is a force.
Gravity originates from the Earth.
The Earth gives its gravitational pull through gravity.
You give your favorite teddy bear a big hug.
When you give your favorite teddy bear a big hug, you want to keep it close to you.
The Earth is like a big teddy bear.
The Earth wants to keep everything close to it.
Things don't float off into space when you drop them.
There is a reason why things don't float off into space when you drop them.
Gravity pulls everything towards it.
The Earth's hug pulling everything towards it is why your toys, your ball, and even you don't float off into space when you drop them.
The Earth's gravity pulls everything towards the Earth.
The person's toys stay on the ground the person is on due to the Earth's gravity.
The ball stays on the ground due to the Earth's gravity.
You stay on the ground due to the Earth (the big teddy bear)'s gravity.
The Earth is saying, "I love you, stay close to me!"
The Earth is saying "I love you, stay close to me!"
The Earth is saying "I love you, stay close to you".
Objects or people on the Earth's surface don't float away when they're standing on the ground.
The surface of the Earth is what we are standing on.
People standing on the ground are on the ground.
